result.execSummary:
The defendant Nichole L Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intecept or other means. Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.

Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
Complete a parenting class.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review to be set by agent if needed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nichole L Bennett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
*
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
*
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review to be set by agent if needed.
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no violent contact order.

Defendant Nichole L Bennett in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to COUNT 1:  Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor and COUNT 2:  Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Nichole L Bennett in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Nichole L Bennett in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.B. (10/4/2005) UNLESS THAT CONTACT IS APPROVED BY THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY CHILDREN'S COURT OR THE BUREAU OF MILWAUKEE CHILD WELFARE IF THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY CHILDREN'S COURT IS NOT INVOLVED.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Nichole L Bennett in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Nichole L Bennett in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
